original_title: Dial Up a Tune On the Jukephone
original_content:
What do you do when you find a nice corded phone with giant buttons out in the wild? You could pay $80/month for a landline, use a VOIP or Bluetooth solution instead, or do something a million times cooler and turn it into a jukebox.
Now when the receiver is lifted, [Turi] hears music instead of a dial tone or a voice on the other end. But playback isnt limited to the handset  theres a headphone jack around back.
To listen to a track, he can either dial one in directly, or call up a random track using one of the smaller buttons below. A handy directory organizes the tunes by the hundreds, putting childrens tracks between 1-99 and the intriguing category hits between 900-999.
The phones new guts are commanded by a Raspberry Pi Pico, which is a great choice for handling the key matrix plus the rest of the buttons. As you may have guessed, theres an DF Player Mini mp3 player that reads the tracks from an SD card. Everything is powered by a rechargeable 18650 battery.
Jukephone is open source, and youll find more pictures on [Turi]s blog post. Be sure to check out the very brief build and demo video after the break.
title: 耳を通じて音楽が流れるジュークボックスになる、ゴージャスな巨大ボタンの有線電話のアップサイクル
body: 電話をジュークボックスに変える方法を紹介。レシーバーを上げると音楽が流れ、ヘッドフォンジャックもある。マトリクス処理にはRaspberry Pi Picoを使用し、DF Player MiniがSDカードから曲を再生。【Turi】のブログで詳細な写真やビルド・デモの動画も公開。
